did.abstract: These photostats of letters were collected from various repositories by Lyman H. Butterfield for his book, "Letters of Benjamin Rush" 2 v. American Philosophical Society Memoirs 30(1951). Some of the topics discussed are Philadelphia and United States politics, slavery, Afro-American churches, and medicine.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This collection of Benjamin Rush Papers was compiled by Lyman Butterfield for his biography of Rush. The papers are photocopies of Rush's correspondence.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Presented by Lyman H. Butterfield and accessioned, 1951

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Benjamin Rush was a physician, patriot, and humanitarian. He graduated from the College of New Jersey (Princeton), 1760, and from the University of Edinburgh, 1768. He was a member of the staff at the Pennsylvania Hospital and was a professor at the University of Pennsylvania.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Consult repository for holders of originals.
